newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean groups plan $20 mln food aid for N.Korea.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean groups plan $20 mln food aid for N.Korea.

text.p: Religious and other civic groups in South Korea plan to raise about $20 million to ship 110,000 tonnes of corn to hunger-stricken North Korea, a spokesman said on Tuesday.

"We have already raised 1.37 billion won ($1.53 million) and set a target of raising 17 billion won ($18.99 million) over the next two months," said Kim Sung-yeoun, planning manager at the Korea Sharing Movement.

Kim said South Korea's six major religious groups and 22 civic organisations plan to ship 5,000 tonnes of corn to North Korea next week and another 5,000 tonnes the following week. The shipments will be made through the South Korean Red Cross.
"Our target is a daunting one but we are confident we will meet it. We raised 1.37 billion won between March 28 and April 7 and our campaign is picking up pace," he said.
Last week, the South Korean Red Cross sent more than $1 million worth of food and vegetable seed to impoverished North Korea.
International aid groups have said famine is only weeks away in North Korea, which has been hit hard by two years of devastating floods.
